bibl.title: Letter from Georgia S. Sutter to Elida Moran, October 14, 1940

div1.p: Sutter invites Elida Moran to a luncheon during the Morans' visit to Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Georgia S. Sutter to Elida Moran, October 14, 1940
div1.opener:
WOMEN'S AUXILIARY
of
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
Oct. 14, 1940
OFFICERS
----
President
MRS. CARLETON A. SUTTER
18410 Newell Road
Shaker Heights, Cleveland, Ohio
First Vice-President
MRS. U. GRANT MILLER
Second Vice-President
MRS. R. T. HUGGS, JR.
Third Vice-President
MRS. A. W. WISHART
Corresponding Secretary
MRS. RALPH VINCE
2603 Fenwick Road
University Heights, Cleveland, Ohio
Recording Secretary
MRS. E. M. WETER
College Campus
Washington, Penns.
Treasurer
MRS. M. C. WALTERSDORF
417 Locust Avenue
Washington, Penns.
Assistant Treasurer
MRS. FRANK H. JUDSON
COMMITTEE CHAIRMEN
----
MRS. WILLIAM B. MCFALL
Membership
MRS. PAUL R. BRADLEY
Project
MRS. JOHN A. MALCOLM
Infirmary
MRS. LESLIE A. FOUST
Social
MISS PEGGY ALLISON
Junior Sociallb/> MRS. RALPH COOPER HUTCHISON
Nominations
My dear Mrs. Moran-
div1.p:
The Washington and
Jefferson Womens Auxiliary
cordially invite you to be
their guest for luncheon
in the George Washington
Hotel, Washington Penn'a
at 12:00 o'clock on Founders
Day. Oct. 26, 1940.
div1.closer:
Very Sincerely (Mrs. Carleton A.)
Georgia S. Sutter
18410 Newell Rd.
Shaker Hts,
Ohio--
